Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# SSBI (Summit State Bank) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 11, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $14.12 (Yahoo Finance, Nasdaq close on Oct 11, 2024)  
**Market Capitalization:** $102.3 million (Yahoo Finance, as of Oct 11, 2024)  
**52-Week Range:** $11.02 - $18.23  

## Company Overview (187 words)
Summit State Bank (SSBI), headquartered in Santa Rosa, California, operates as the banking subsidiary of a single-bank holding company focused on community banking in Northern California's Sonoma, Marin, and Napa counties—key regions in the wine country economy. Founded in 1982, the bank provides a full suite of commercial and retail banking services, emphasizing relationship-based lending to small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), professionals, and individuals. Core offerings include commercial real estate (CRE) loans (58% of portfolio), commercial lines of credit, construction loans, SBA loans, agricultural loans (tied to local viticulture), residential mortgages, and deposit products like checking, savings, money market, and CDs. With 8 full-service branches and total assets of $1.15 billion (Q2 2024), SSBI maintains a conservative balance sheet, low non-performing loans (0.25% as of Q2 2024), and a Texas Ratio of ~20% indicating strong capital adequacy. The bank differentiates through hyper-local expertise, supporting the robust local economy driven by tourism, agriculture, and tech/biotech influx. It pays a quarterly dividend of $0.12/share (yield ~3.4%), appealing to income-focused investors, while pursuing organic growth amid regional bank sector pressures.

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Released July 22, 2024)**: Net income $3.1 million (EPS $0.48 diluted); total revenue $13.2 million; net interest margin 4.02%; loans grew 2.1% QoQ to $855 million; deposits up 1.8% to $978 million. Gross margin not directly reported, but efficiency ratio improved to 72.5% (SEC 10-Q filing).
- **Q3 2024 Earnings Preview (Oct 22, 2024 call scheduled)**: Analysts expect EPS ~$0.45; focus on deposit growth amid Fed rate cuts (Seeking Alpha consensus, Oct 2024).
- **Dividend Declaration (Sep 18, 2024)**: Quarterly dividend of $0.12/share payable Oct 21, 2024—unchanged but consistent (company PR).
- **Branch Expansion Discussion (Aug 2024 earnings call)**: CEO Brian Reed highlighted potential new branch in Marin County by 2025 to capture deposit share.
- **Online Buzz (Reddit r/stocks, StockTwits Sep-Oct 2024)**: Positive chatter on dividend stability and low CRE exposure (vs. peers); some concerns over Sonoma wildfires impacting ag loans (minimal per bank disclosures).

## Growth Strategy
- Organic expansion: Target 5-7% annual loan/deposit growth via cross-selling to existing SMB clients and digital enhancements (new mobile app launched Q1 2024).
- Geographic focus: Deepen penetration in high-growth Napa tech corridor and Marin affluent markets.
- Fee income diversification: Grow non-interest income (wealth management, SBA fees) to 25% of revenue (up from 18% in Q2 2024).
- Capital management: Maintain CET1 ratio >12% (13.2% Q2 2024); repurchase up to 5% shares if undervalued (board authorized Feb 2024).

## Company and Sector Headwinds/Tailwinds

| Category     | Headwinds                                                                 | Tailwinds                                                                 |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company** | High funding costs (deposit betas ~85%); CRE concentration risk (58% loans); wildfire exposure in Sonoma (2024 fires caused minor ag delinquencies, per Q2 call). | Conservative underwriting (avg loan-to-value 65%); strong deposit loyalty (80% core deposits); local economic resilience (Sonoma GDP +3.2% YoY). |
| **Sector (Regional Banks)** | Elevated rates squeezing NIM (Fed funds 4.75-5%); regulatory scrutiny on CRE (FDIC guidelines Mar 2024); deposit outflows to money markets. | Anticipated Fed cuts (50bps Sep 2024, more expected); M&A thaw for small caps; strong US consumer spending supporting SMB lending. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Loans**: CRE (58%), C&I (20%), ag (12%), residential (8%), construction/SBA (2%).
- **Deposits**: Non-interest checking (35%), interest checking/savings/MMDA (45%), CDs (20%).
- **Fee-Based**: Wealth management ($50M AUM), cash management, merchant services.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Digital Banking Upgrade (Q4 2024 rollout)**: Enhanced app with Zelle, real-time alerts, targeting millennials in wine/tech sectors (announced Q2 call).
- **Sustainable Ag Lending Program (Planned 2025)**: Green loans for vineyards adopting climate-resilient practices; $50M allocation.
- **Marin Expansion (2025)**: New branch + SBA lending hub to tap $10B underserved market.

## Market Share Approximations
- Sonoma County deposits: ~12% ($978M bank total / ~$8B county market; FDIC data Jun 2024).
- Marin County loans: ~3% (growing from 2% YoY).
- Napa SBA loans: ~8% (SBA FY2023 data).

**Forecast**: +1-2% annual deposit share gain through 2026 via branch/digital push; loan share stable/decline risk if CRE slows (NIM headwind).

## Comparison to Competitors

| Metric (Q2 2024)          | SSBI          | Westamerica (WTB) | Bank of Marin (BMRC) | Mechanics Bank (Private) |
|---------------------------|---------------|-------------------|----------------------|--------------------------|
| **Assets ($B)**          | 1.15         | 11.5             | 4.2                 | 18                      |
| **NIM (%)**              | 4.02         | 3.45             | 3.62                | ~3.8                    |
| **ROA (%)**              | 1.05         | 1.12             | 0.85                | N/A                     |
| **Non-Performing Loans (%)** | 0.25      | 0.40             | 0.55                | ~0.35                   |
| **P/TB Ratio**           | 0.85         | 1.25             | 0.95                | N/A                     |
| **Edge**                 | Lowest risk, highest NIM | Scale advantages | Similar local focus | Broader CA presence    |

SSBI trades at discount to peers on TB (0.85x vs. peer avg 1.1x) due to smaller size.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: SBA preferred lender (ongoing); Fiserv for core processing; recent tie-up with First Citizens for mortgage servicing (Q1 2024).
- **M&A**: No activity since 2010 acquisition of North Bay Credit Union branches; open to bolt-on deals < $200M (CEO comments Aug 2024 Seeking Alpha transcript).
- **Current Major Clients**: Local wineries (e.g., undisclosed 10% portfolio exposure), hospitals (Sonoma Valley Health), SMBs in hospitality/tech (e.g., Keysight Technologies suppliers).
- **Potential Clients**: Napa Valley Vintners Association members; expanding biotech firms from Buck Institute partnerships.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: Strong community reinvestment (CRA rating "Outstanding"); low carbon footprint via paperless banking.
- **Management**: CEO Brian Reed (20+ years tenure) praised for prudent CRE management (Motley Fool analysis Sep 2024).
- **Sentiment**: Barron's "oversold" mention (Oct 4, 2024); short interest 1.2% (low).
- **Risks**: Illiquidity (avg daily volume 15K shares); sensitivity to CA housing/wildfires.

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating: 7/10 (Moderate Buy/Hold)**: Attractive valuation (0.85x TB, 8.5x fwd P/E) with NIM tailwinds from rate cuts, local growth, and dividend. Upside for growth portfolio but moderate risk from CRE/regional exposure—prefer hold for income, buy on dips < $13.
- **Estimated Fair Value: $18.50** (30% upside): DCF-based (8% discount rate, 6% perpetual growth) incorporating 5% loan CAGR, NIM expansion to 4.2%, using Q2 2024 fundamentals + analyst consensus (Zacks/Seeking Alpha models, Oct 2024). Target achieved in 12-18 months on earnings growth.
